intro: Agnorhiza elata, commonly known as the slender agnorhiza, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. Agnorhiza elata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
